title: How to Separate Lettuce Leaves

steps.headline: Turn the lettuce upside down.
steps.description: You should be able to see its stem or core facing up to you.

steps.headline: Use a pointed knife to cut out the stem or core in a cone shape.
steps.description: Alternatively, bash the lettuce stem-side down on the kitchen bench. This will release the stem or core.

steps.headline: Hold the lettuce upside down under running water.
As you're holding it, gently loosen the leaves.
steps.description: You should be able to pull the leaves apart now. Wash them to remove dirt, etc., and spin in a salad spinner before using.

text: Turn the lettuce upside down. You should be able to see its stem or core facing up to you. Use a pointed knife to cut out the stem or core in a cone shape. Alternatively, bash the lettuce stem-side down on the kitchen bench. This will release the stem or core. Hold the lettuce upside down under running water.  As you're holding it, gently loosen the leaves. You should be able to pull the leaves apart now. Wash them to remove dirt, etc., and spin in a salad spinner before using.
